paragraphs.content: My breath is corrupt, my days are extinct, the graves are ready for me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My breath is corrupt, my days are extinct, the graves are ready for me.

paragraphs.content: Are there not mockers with me? and doth not mine eye continue in their provocation?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Are there not mockers with me? and doth not mine eye continue in their provocation?

paragraphs.content: Lay down now, put me in a surety with thee; who is he that will strike hands with me?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Lay down now, put me in a surety with thee; who is he that will strike hands with me?

paragraphs.content: For thou hast hid their heart from understanding: therefore shalt thou not exalt them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For thou hast hid their heart from understanding: therefore shalt thou not exalt them.

paragraphs.content: He that speaketh flattery to his friends, even the eyes of his children shall fail.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that speaketh flattery to his friends, even the eyes of his children shall fail.

paragraphs.content: He hath made me also a byword of the people; and aforetime I was as a tabret.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He hath made me also a byword of the people; and aforetime I was as a tabret.

paragraphs.content: Mine eye also is dim by reason of sorrow, and all my members are as a shadow.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Mine eye also is dim by reason of sorrow, and all my members are as a shadow.

paragraphs.content: Upright men shall be astonied at this, and the innocent shall stir up himself against the hypocrite.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Upright men shall be astonied at this, and the innocent shall stir up himself against the hypocrite.

paragraphs.content: The righteous also shall hold on his way, and he that hath clean hands shall be stronger and stronger.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The righteous also shall hold on his way, and he that hath clean hands shall be stronger and stronger.

paragraphs.content: But as for you all, do ye return, and come now: for I cannot find one wise man among you.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But as for you all, do ye return, and come now: for I cannot find one wise man among you.

paragraphs.content: My days are past, my purposes are broken off, even the thoughts of my heart.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My days are past, my purposes are broken off, even the thoughts of my heart.

paragraphs.content: They change the night into day: the light is short because of darkness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They change the night into day: the light is short because of darkness.

paragraphs.content: If I wait, the grave is mine house: I have made my bed in the darkness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: If I wait, the grave is mine house: I have made my bed in the darkness.

paragraphs.content: I have said to corruption, Thou art my father: to the worm, Thou art my mother, and my sister.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I have said to corruption, Thou art my father: to the worm, Thou art my mother, and my sister.

paragraphs.content: And where is now my hope? as for my hope, who shall see it?
paragraphs.contentHtml: And where is now my hope? as for my hope, who shall see it?

paragraphs.content: They shall go down to the bars of the pit, when our rest together is in the dust.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They shall go down to the bars of the pit, when our rest together is in the dust.
